fields.description:
The manually assignement of tasks to the right assignee during daily is the most timeconsuming action during our dailys. 
The scrummaster has to assign each task (if it was unassigned) to the correct person via drop down box.

Following Idea: 
If a task from one swimmlane is moved to another swimmlane **ONTO!!** an already assigned task in the other swimmlane the assignee of that task should be used for the new moved task.

Dailys could be quicker than. Hope my description is good enough and you understand what I mean.
fields.summary: More intelligent task assignment in Sprintboards

fields.description:
It would be very helpful to be able to set both components and labels to be inactive/disabled, so that they would still show on existing issues but not be able to be added to new ones.

 

It would also be very helpful to be able to merge two labels or merge two components.
fields.summary: Allow merging and deactivation of components and labels in JIRA

fields.description:
Currently, when you create or edit an issue using the "old" issue view, the Epic link field shows the option *Show done epics*, and when this field is selected, it shows both open and done epics. 

It would be better if the expression  "Show only Done epics" visible instead of "Show done epics" and, when this option is selected, only "done" Epics should display on the field.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to see the  "Show only Done epics" instead of "Show done epics" in the issue creation/editing screen

fields.description:
At this moment the filter results gadget only shows the results of a filter as it is, not allowing to make a subselection within the gadget. 

It would be useful if this gadget has the option to select certain results of the filter within the gadget, to restrict the results on the gadget for a certain large filter or to monitor specific results in a certain time-frame.
fields.summary: Subselection for filter results gadget

fields.description:

	at com.atlassian.jira.web.pagebuilder.AbstractJspDecorator.writePreHead(AbstractJspDecorator.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.pagebuilder.DefaultPageBuilder.flush(DefaultPageBuilder.java:92)
	...

	at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(Preconditions.java:122)

fields.description:
By default, the linked issues view will display the following fields:
 * Issue key.
 * Issue summary.
 * Issue assignee.
 * Issue priority.
 * Issue status.

!Screen Shot 2019-07-15 at 16.41.05.png|width=357,height=184!

As a Jira administrator, I would like to have the option to customize the linked issues view, including more fields or changing the order of the fields.
fields.summary: Customisable linked issues fields view and order.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Importing Custom Field History via JSON, it's inconsistent.
To import them, you need to use their visual name instead of the system name of the custom field.
So, in cases where the custom field is renamed, it will not update in the History of the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JSON file that will create an issue with History
# Add a custom field item to be imported in the History

h3. Expected Results
It will be imported using the system name of the custom field.

h3. Actual Results
It uses the visual name.

h3. Workaround
None at the time.
fields.summary: Inconsistent Behavior Importing Custom Field History via JSON

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary:
Radio button custom field option does not show on clicking in new issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Enable new issue view > Create some custom fields of radio button type with multiple options > Add it to the screen
On the view screen click on the radio button fields on the right-hand panel to edit it. Instead of showing the option , it shows "no options"
h3. Expected Results
>> New issue view should show all the custom field option to select

h3. Actual Results
>> No Option while editing custom field in new issue view(see attachment)


(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround
>> Goto old issue view to edit the custom field
fields.summary: Radio button custom field option does not show on clicking in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User object is being sent as UserJsonBean when the webhook is transitioned through a post-function in workflow.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a webhook
# Add a post-function to workflow to trigger the webhook on a transition
# Create an issue and transition it
# Check the webhook data received

h3. Expected Results
User object is sent as following JSON format:
{noformat}
"user": {
    "self": "https://<site-name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=<accountId>",
    "accountId": "<accountId",
    "emailAddress": "\"?\"",
    "avatarUrls": {
      "48x48": "https://avatar-management--avatars.us-west-2.prod.public.atl-paas.net/default-avatar-3.png?size=48&s=48",
      "24x24": "https://avatar-management--avatars.us-west-2.prod.public.atl-paas.net/default-avatar-3.png?size=24&s=24",
      "16x16": "https://avatar-management--avatars.us-west-2.prod.public.atl-paas.net/default-avatar-3.png?size=16&s=16",
      "32x32": "https://avatar-management--avatars.us-west-2.prod.public.atl-paas.net/default-avatar-3.png?size=32&s=32"
    }
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
User object appears in *UserJsonBean* as per following format:
{noformat}
"user": "UserJsonBean{self=https://<site-name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/user?accountId=<accountId>, name=null, key=null, accountId=<accountId>, emailAddress=\"?\", avatarUrls={48x48=https://avatar-management--avatars.us-west-2.prod.public.atl-paas.net/default-avatar-3.png?size=48&s=48, 24x24=https://avatar-management--avatars.us-west-2.prod.public.atl-paas.net/default-avatar-3.png?size=24&s=24, 16x16=https://avatar-management--avatars.us-west-2.prod.public.atl-paas.net/default-avatar-3.png?size=16&s=16, 32x32=https://avatar-management--avatars.us-west-2.prod.public.atl-paas.net/default-avatar-3.png?size=32&s=32}, displayName=<display-name>, active=true, timeZone=<time-zone>}"
{noformat}

h3. Notes
JSON data appears correctly for events configured in the webhook directly. The format is broken when the webhook is triggered through a post-function.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Workflow post-function sends User object as UserJsonBean through webhook

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Unable to scroll the scroll bar smoothly of the issues list on the "Issues and filters" page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # New issue view feature is turned on
 # Go to <instance URL>/projects/<project key>/issues/?filter=allopenissues
 # Scroll down and while scrolling up the scrollbar, the glitch will be noticed

h3. Expected Results
Able to scroll without any issue

h3. Actual Results
Unable to scroll smoothly

h3. Workaround
* Switching to *Old issue view* via <Instance URL>/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa
fields.summary: Unable to scroll properly with New issue view on the open issue section

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding comments that contain attachments in the new issue view, the comment will fail to be added if the attachment is *formatted*.

h3. Environment
This only happens in the *new issue view*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue
 # Add a formatted comment
 # Add an attachment (either by dragging and dropping or by the attachment button) to a formatted section
 # Save comment

h3. Expected Results
Comment is saved

h3. Actual Results
*We couldn't save your comment* error is returned:
* !Screen Shot 2019-07-12 at 7.00.59 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The comment does not fail to be added if the attachment is added outside a "formatted area"

h3. Additional information
The video below represents situations where the problem is and is not reproduced. 
* [^attachmentError.mov]
fields.summary: Comment with Formatted Attachment fails to be added

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Files named with special character like carriage return are not accessible

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create a file and then rename the file using \r or any other special character. 

h3. Expected Results
Jira decodes those characters successfully.

h3. Actual Results
If you try to access the file a 404 error is returned.
* You will notice that the URL points to the encoded character like: *%0D*.
 
h3. Workaround
Use a decoding tool to parse the appropriate link.
fields.summary: Files named with special character are not accessible (404)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing a dashboard with the "Assign to me" gadget, the icon to previous page has pixels missing.

 !Pixels missing.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Simply have the "Assign to me" gadget on a Dashboard. Configure the gadget so it has more than 1 page selectable.
fields.summary: When viewing a dashboard with the "Assign to me" gadget, the icon to previous page has pixels missing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Any Jira Cloud REST API endpoint that returns user objects in the JSON response will return a blank email address for any non-managed users. This happens regardless of if they are set to "Public" or "Private" in the Atlassian Account privacy settings (which do not have the email address specific setting for non-managed accounts).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite an unmanaged user to your instance if one does not already exist
 # run /rest/api/3/user/search?query=<email address of user>

h3. Expected Results

The returned user object email field is populated with the expected email address

h3. Actual Results

The email address field is returned with an empty string as the value

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no workaround.
fields.summary: REST API endpoints that return user objects leave email field blank for unmanaged users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Media player buttons never disappear when adding a .move file as a comment using the new view
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Add a .mov file as a comment using the new view and click to reproduce the file
h3. Expected Results

Media player buttons will disappear/ be hidden
h3. Actual Results

Media player buttons never disappear
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-12 at 13.50.32.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

There isn't a workaround for that.
fields.summary: Media player buttons never disappear when adding a .move file as a comment using the new view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you are in the New Issue View, if you scroll down and then after accessing an Issue Tab, it won't renderer correctly, scrolling up.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue;
# Add a Tab to the Screen
# Scroll down a bit, letting the Summary of the issue not appearing
# Open the issue Tab and scroll

h3. Expected Results
The Tab will be rendered normally, pushing the remaining view down.

h3. Actual Results
It scrolls up with all the screen, overlapping the top of the page.

 [^Tabs.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
No workaround is available.
fields.summary: The Tabs are not Rendering Correctly After Scrolling in the New Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a issue from the backlog with the create another option checked the cursor goes to the backlog 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 [^create another bug.mov] 

h3. Expected Results
The cursor should appear on the summary of the 2nd issue 

h3. Workaround
Click on the field in the create screen of the second issue
fields.summary: When creating a issue from the backlog with the create another option checked the cursor goes to the backlog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Custom field *Text Only (Read-only)* is editable in the new issue where the field supposed to be *Read-only*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a (Read-only) custom field 
# Add the field to the appropriate screens
# Go to the issue where the field is present and the field would be editable in the new issue view.

h3. Expected Results
* Field should not be editable and maintained for read-only

h3. Actual Results
* The field is editable

h3.Workaround
* Remove the field from *Edit Screen* operation. This will make the field non-editable in the new issue view.
fields.summary: To make Readonly Custom field not editable in the New Issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Create linked issue is not copying the field values from the original issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create linked issue from an issue

h3. Expected Results
The linked issue is created with the reporter field set to the current user, an appropriate priority, and custom fields with predefined values.

h3. Actual Results
The linked issue is created with the reporter field set to null, the priority set to the default, and the custom fields with predefined values are set to empty.

No exception is thrown.

h3. Workaround
Switch to Old View, then update the problematic fields.
fields.summary: Create linked issue is not copying the field values from the original issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Environment

n/a
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with a user custom field
 # Create a CSV file that has a column for that custom field
 # Populate the user custom field column in the CSV file with either valid account IDs or valid email addresses
 # Import the CSV file using External System Import, and map the custom field column to the correct custom field in Jira

h3. Expected Results

The file is imported, and the custom field is populate with the correct users for the new issues.
h3. Actual Results

The import fails, because the users could not be created that were referenced in the custom field column.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Notes

Related to [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACJIRA-1751]
h3. Workaround

Specifying custom user fields by username is still supported in the short term.
fields.summary: Importing CSV where user custom fields are specified by account ID or email does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When deleting the original default group, when some add-on was installed, after adding a new group to be the new default group cause the add-on to stop working because it doesn't have product access.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Example 1:
 # Install one add-on having one default group
 # Go to User Management > Groups > Create a new group
 # Go to Product access and set this new group as a *Default Access Group*
 # Delete the original Default Access Group

h3. Expected Results
The add-on will still work properly.

h3. Actual Results
The add-on stop working because the add-on user does not have access to Jira.

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround
*To prevent this issue, it is necessary to reinstall the add-on.*
fields.summary: Deleting originally default group may cause add-ons to stop working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Today, once you try to add a comment or the description and add an attachment, the "Save" button doesn't work until the upload is complete.
However, if you click in the "Save", it doesn't throw any message, being misleading.

h3. Expected Results
Have a message thrown about the need to wait for the finish of the upload.

h3. Actual Results
There isn't any message.
fields.summary: Have a Message that the Attachment is Not Fully Uploaded

fields.description:
h4. Description
Checking Jira we could verify that when opening different tabs in the browser, it is consuming about 200-300MB of memory

Comparing the new issue view with the old issue view we were able to confirm that the new view is using just over 4x the memory that old issue view is (~600mb vs ~130mb).

We've performed some tests to validate this information and checked this directly using Firefox in my instance, and by opening some tabs we were able to verify that we had an increase of the memory consumption, as you can see on the image below:
 !impact2.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Suggestion for Improvement
This behavior may be a recurring issue when using multiple tabs with Jira openen. Would be great to be able to reduce the memory consumption in Jira.
fields.summary: Improve memory consumption in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue type schemes are missing on Issue type page

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the issue type page

h3. Expected Results
The issue types schemes where issue types are added should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
The list of schemes where the issue type is added doesn't return all results

h3. Notes
This issue is not impacting all sites

h3. Workaround
Contact [Atlassian Support|http://support.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Issue type schemes are sometimes missing on Issue type page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the deactivated user had commented on the issue, that deactivated user is still listed in @mention.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As an active user, add comment on an issue
# Site admin deactivate that user
# Go back to that issue as another user, add a comment and use @mention to see the list of users

h3. Expected Results
Deactivated user is not shown in the @mention list.

h3. Actual Results
Deactivated user is still showing in the @mention list.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround in the moment.
fields.summary: If deactivated user had commented on the issue, that deactivated user is still listed in @mention

fields.description:
Took a while to figure out how to edit my profile.

In the profile page, there's a pen, but it's next to "Activity Stream" so ignored it until I got desperate.

Just on a macbook screen, if this were a larger screen the association between pen icon and profile settings would be even greater.

 

BTW: I had no idea what component this should be in, so I just chose something to allow the ticket to be created (how does a typical user know what component to file a bug against?).

 

 

!image-2019-03-26-11-26-37-391.png!!image-2019-07-11-09-06-02-535.png!
fields.summary: Edit icon in wrong place

fields.description:
'Where is my field' is not part of the new issue view.

It would be very useful to have this option as it helps with understanding why a field is not showing on the screen.
fields.summary: Please include 'Where is my field' in the new issue view
Using bullet point and color format makes the new editor to add new line before and after the color format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the Update Issue field rule in a team-managed project(it applies for classic projects too) for a Time Stamp custom field adds the wrong time. Seems like the timezone used to update the field is GMT, instead of respecting the timezone of the user.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a team-managed project(it applies for classic projects too), Add a Time Stamp Custom field to your issue type screen
 # Navigate to the project board > click in the three dots menu at the top right corner > *Manage Rules*
 # Create a rule to update the Custom field with the date/time of when the issue moves when the issue is transitioned to "In progress":
!Screen Shot 2019-07-10 at 18.00.03.png|width=295,height=237!
 # Create a new issue and transfer it to "In Progress"

h3. Expected Results

The issue should be updated with the current date/time.
h3. Actual Results

The issue is updated with the current date/time in GMT, not respecting the current timezone configured to the Jira Site.

In the example below, the issue should be updated with 5:40 PM (Brasilia time), however, it was updated with 8:40 PM:

  !Screen Shot 2019-07-10 at 18.04.47.png|width=365,height=128!
h3. Workaround

None at this moment.
fields.summary: Update custom field rule add the wrong date/time for Time Stamp field

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It would be good to change the order of Project Roles. 
In cases where we have too many roles, it's hard to find the right one and pressing the first letter doesn't work as well.

h3. Expected Results
Have the option to change the order.

h3. Actual Results
There isn't this option.
fields.summary: Option to Order the List of Project Roles

fields.description:
The Batching Email Notifications functionality was a great first step, but when someone enters a comment on an issue that I'm assigned to or watching AND mentions me, I now get two emails, one for the mention and one for the issue update where before I got one.  And the goal is to reduce the number for folks.

It would be great to add an option to treat the the mentions the same as issue updates.
fields.summary: Provide the option to batch mentions with issue updates

fields.description:
In the new issue view, there's a flag option to Hide done sub-tasks in the Parent issue view, however, once the page is refreshed, the option is not flagged anymore.

!image-2019-07-10-12-43-46-162.png|width=504,height=252!

It would be nice to make this option permanent until it's manually changed again.
 * *Workaround*
There is no current work around
fields.summary: Make the "Hide Done sub-tasks" option permanent

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Inviting users through the People page of a project associating them with a role that grants the Browse Project permission grants Jira access + project access in the first time.

If the user is deleted from the instance and the steps above are repeated, the user won't have the access to the project and the admin will need to manually add them to the project once again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access the project settings of a project
# Add a user to the instance by their e-mail address through the *Add People* button and associate with a role that grants the Browse Project permission.
# User will have access to the instance and the project.
# Delete the user from the *People* page
# Delete the user from the instance through the *User Management* page
# Repeat the process until Step 2
# User will have access to the instance, but won't have access to the project this time.

h3. Expected Results
User should have access to the project.

h3. Actual Results
User doesn't have access to the project.

h3. Workaround
Re-add the user to the project manually afterward.
fields.summary: Inviting users through people page and granting permission only works in the first time

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, there is no way to search for Issues that have been in more than 1 Sprint.

h3. Proposed solution

Add a JQL function that verifies the Sprint total of Issues so it can be used in searches.

* {{sprintcount > 1}}
fields.summary: Add JQL for Sprint count

fields.description:
In the old issue view, the *Share* option will popup a new window where the cursor will be automatically pointed to *User name or email*. 
 !OV.JPG|thumbnail! 

However, the behavior is different in the new issue view where the user will have to click on the *User name or email* box to start the search. This could lead to the unwanted operation for example, the letter "i" reassigns the issue to the current user, "m" opens a new comment

 !NV.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New Jira View share-issue option has no default focus

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attempt to update a field with single select list type on new issue view, it shows "No matches found" when the current value contains leading or trailing whitespace.
 
h3. Environment
* New issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a priority with leading or trailing whitespace (eg: "Roadblock " or " Roadblock")
# Create a new issue with the newly created priority
# Attempt to change the priority of the newly created issue

h3. Expected Results
A list of priorities is showing:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Actual Results
"No matches found" is showing:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Notes
This is happening to all single select list custom fields, eg:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!   

h3. Workaround
* Configure the field and remove the leading or trailing whitespace from the option.
fields.summary: Single Select List is Showing  "No matches found" When The Current Value Contains Leading or Trailing Whitespace.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding an image from a web page no longer works in the new issue view's editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit an issue's description
# Add an image from the web in the format {{!imageUrl!}}

h3. Expected Results
Embedded image links should display properly like how it used to in the old issue view.

h3. Actual Results
Can not save a functional image link.

h3. Notes
* In the old editor, you could include that image in your description using bounding exclamation points.

h3. Workaround
Currently, while the new issue view is turned on in the {{Personal settings}}, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Link to an image in ticket description does not work in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*

Customer name isn't displaying when trying to mention @Customer on JIRA Mobile App
h3. *Steps to Replicate*
 # Customer Raise a Service Desk Request
 # On JIra Mobile App, agent mentions the customer by entering @mention

h3. *Expected Result*
The customer would appear on the list of mentionable users
 !Screenshot 2019-07-10 at 3.02.59 AM.png|width=504,height=185!

h3. *Actual Result*
Customer isn't mentionable
 !Screenshot_20190710-030733_Jira.jpg|width=249,height=248!

h3. *Workaround*
-
fields.summary: Customer name isn't displaying when trying to mention @Customer on JIRA Mobile App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking on Filter Name on Issue Navigator doesn't refresh the issue list
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open 2 tabs, one with the filter to load and the other to create a new issue from the instance.
 # Click on the desired filter you have created and the latest result will be displayed.
 # Create a new issue from the other tab, and click on the filter again.

h3. Expected Results
The new issue appears on the Issue list when clicking on the Filter name.

h3. Actual Results
The result will not include the newly create issue even if you click on the filter unless you click on the search button or refresh the page

h3. Workaround
- Refresh the page or click on the Issue Navigator's Search button
fields.summary: Clicking on Filter Name on Issue Navigator doesn't refresh the issue list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding images that have high resolutions are breaking the email notifications.
It occurs on all mailboxes - Gmail, Outlook, Email Application on MacOS, etc.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue;
# Add an attachment that is an image with high resolution
# Open the notification email

h3. Expected Results
The image shows correctly in the notification.

h3. Actual Results
It returns a blank image, as it was corrupted, even though the image is added correctly. It works with images with lower resolution.

 !Notification Break.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround is available.
fields.summary: Adding an Attachment with High Resolution Breaks the Email Notification

fields.description:
The new batch notification does bring the information of the issue type, written in the email body when a new issue is created, different than the old format that had the icon of the issue type on the top of the email.
Updates on existing issues do not include any information about the issue type.

It would be useful if the new notifications could have the issue type icon as well. Here are some examples of why this feature would be useful:

{quote}
1) Issue type is very important, and the icons use color and shape to highlight the type for quicker at-a-glance comprehension.

2) Issue type icons used to be at the top of the email notification, which made them easy to find and helped user digest that information first. That is a helpful placement. Ideally, the icon would be added AND up at the top, but if not the words should still be moved up to the top of the email.
{quote}
fields.summary: Add the issue type icon to the new notification template

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Cannot navigate to next month from the date picker when using IE11
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Create a ticket with a date picker field
 # Make sure you are viewing the ticket form the new issue view
 # Select a date, for instance, 9th July 2019
 #  Open the ticket from IE11 and try to select ">" the next button to change it to the next month date.
 # Reproduce the issue from IE11

h3. *Expected Results*

User should be able to navigate to next month and select a date from IE11
h3. *Actual Results*

The date picker not responsive from IE11
h3. *Workaround*
 # Edit the date picker from other browsers
 # Switch to old issue view on IE11 to change the date.
fields.summary: Date picker not responsive in Internet Explorer 11 when using new issue view.

fields.description:
In User Management, the number of Users shown per page is fixed at 20. For an org with hundreds of users, this can mean paging through _many_ pages when performing User Administration functions.

It would be great if we could set the # of Users to display per page, perhaps in increments of 20, i.e. 20, 40, 60, 80, 100. The increment logic may want to avoid showing increments that are greater than the licensed user limit.
I'm sure there are good performance reasons for the hard limit of 20, but these suggested increments should hopefully not pose any significant performance issues, while extending the administration functionality greatly for orgs with many users.
fields.summary: Ability to customize the number of Users shown per page

fields.description: For orgs with hundreds of users, identifying those users with access but who haven't logged in for many months currently requires going page by page. This would be made much simpler if we could sort the full user list by the "Last seen on site" column header.
fields.summary: Ability to sort by "Last seen on site" in User Administration

fields.description:
h3.Issue description

Pasting the Formatted text to description/ rich text box field while creating an issue, doesnot retain the formatting

h3.Steps to replicate the issue

Copy the formatted text from an issue

Click on create issue button
On the Pop up while creating the issue, paste the copied text
The format is lost.

h3.Expected result
The format should be intact

h3.Actual result.
The description field or any rich text box field looses the format

Also observed that the issue is when creating the issue. When pasting the text to an existing issue, retains the format.

h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pasting the Formatted text to description/ rich text box field while creating an issue, does not retain the formatting

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The customer wants to be able to share the attachments of the Jira issues with other users directly and currently, there is no way of directly redirecting a user to an attachment of the issue. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide share option for attachments using which a user can copy the link to the attachment. 
h3. Workaround

 
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Direct links for Jira issue attachments.

fields.description:

Allow Project Admin to specify the user from a particular domain level for Project Permission
fields.summary: Allow Project Admin to specify the user from a particular domain level for Project Permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Transitioning issues from Jira mobile iOS app throws an error if there is a value for a cascading field on the screen.

h3. Environment

Jira mobile iOS
(Android is working)

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Create a cascading custom field;
# Add to a transition screen in the workflow;
# Go to the Jira mobile app and try to transition the issue giving the cascading field a value.

h3. Expected results

The ticket is transitioned with no problems.

h3. Actual result

The ticket is not transitioned and the error below is thrown.
 !WhatsApp Image 2019-07-08 at 16.38.57.jpeg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Remove the cascading field from the screen.
fields.summary: Transitioning issues from Jira mobile iOS app throws an error if there is value for a cascading field on the screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When working with Jira tickets in the New Issue View - New editor - the presence of images create an automated scroll event that essentially blocks access to the "Save" button.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue;
# In the New Issue View, add images until the "Save" button is not appearing;
# Try to scroll down the page.

 [^bug_UI.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
You can scroll down and save the changes.

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't allow you to scroll down.

h3. Workaround
Use the command + Enter (Mac) or Ctrl + Enter (Windows) to save the content.
Firefox and Safari this is not reproducible as well.
fields.summary: New Editor Prevents to Scroll if the Save Button is not Showing in the Screen on Google Chrome

fields.description:

Webhook to listen the Issue security level Changes
Currently Webhook listens to changes on issues, projects and user management.
It will be a good feature to include the feature that can listen changes on issue level security
fields.summary: Webhook to listen the Issue security level Changes

Customer not able to shrink/collapse code block in new issue view

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to shrink/collapse code block in new issue view

h3. Why this is important
Customers should be able to to shrink/collapse code block in new issue view
fields.summary: Ability to shrink/collapse code block in new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the shortcut to convert text into a code block, when using Google Chrome, this triggers the browser's *Device Mode* shortcut instead.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a text field in the old issue view in Jira on your Google Chrome browser
# Hit the shortcut for code block {{*Control+Shift+M*}} or {{*Command+Shift+M*}}

h3. Expected Results

This is supposed to execute the code block function just like in the new view.

 !_KFF-5__Test_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

It opens the browser's *Device Mode*

 !console.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note

Tested on Firefox as well which works as expected and adds the code block.

h3. Workaround

# Only use this command in the new issue view
# Manually insert the code block format which is double brackets on each end !_JRACLOUD-72438__Code_block_shortcut_does_not_work_on_in_old_issue_view_-_Create_and_track_feature_requests_for_Atlassian_products_.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Code block shortcut does not work on in old issue view

!Screen Shot 2019-07-08 at 4.16.24 PM.png|width=449,height=275!

 

However with the New Issue View, we are unable to see the email addresses of Reporter and Assignees which is highly inconvenient.

Atlassian

NEW ISSUE VIEW:

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
In new issue view, when a user tried to create an inline child issue for an Epic, and that child issue type is missing "Epic Link" field, they would get error message saying "We couldn't create the child issue":
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
This message is misleading and does not indicate why the issue could not be created.

h3. Suggested solution
Update the error message to inform the user that the child issue could not be created because of :
- missing "Epic Link" field.
- Validator added in create issue transition
fields.summary: Misleading error message when user cannot create inline child issue for an Epic

fields.description:

Rest API for Issue Security -  Doesn't List Members ( Groups or users) for the security Level.

Documentation : [Rest API- Issue level security |https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-securitylevel-id-get]

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding a table with empty cell(s) breaks the table's format when you switch the issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a table with empty cell(s) in either *Old Issue View* or *New Issue View*:
#* Example1: *Old Issue View*
 !Old Issue View - Table is added in Old Issue View - Edit.png|thumbnail!  !Old Issue View - Table is added in Old Issue View - Saved.png|thumbnail! 
#* Example2: *New Issue View*
 !New Issue View - Table is added in New Issue View - Edit.png|thumbnail!  !New Issue View - Table is added in New Issue View - Saved.png|thumbnail! 
# Witch the issue view:
#* Example1: switch from *Old Issue View* to *New Issue View*
 !New Issue View - Table is added in Old Issue View.png|thumbnail! 
#* Example2: switch from *New Issue View* to *Old Issue View*
 !Old Issue View - Table is added in New Issue View.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Table appears the same when you switch issue view

h3. Actual Results
Table format is broken when issue view is switched, see the screenshots above.

h3. Workaround
Add a character in the empty cells, for example a space (new issue view), hyphen or a dot.
fields.summary: Inconsistency in formatting table between Old Issue View and New Issue View when there's an empty cell in the table

fields.description:
h3. Issue

Keyboard ShortCut 'm' to add a comment doesnot work when we change the Activity from "Comments" to "History" or "Time Balance"

h3. Steps to replicate
* Access  any ticket ( in New issue view)
* Change the activity from "Comments"  to "History" or "Time Balance"
* Press the shortcut button to add a comment i.e *m*

h3. Expected Result:
Comment field should be displayed at the bottom

h3. Actual result
A comment box is not displayed.
fields.summary: Keyboard ShortCut 'm' to add a comment doesnot work when we change the Activity from "Comments" to "History" or "Time Balance"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding a Space Character to the Priority field value from [https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa] causes any other Priority value to not display on the new issue view.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud
* New issue view
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to your *Jira Settings > Issues > Priorities* or [https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa]
 # Click on any Priority value, edit it and add a "<space>" after the text string.
 !priority.png|thumbnail! 
# Update it.
# Go to the Issue and you won't be able to find any other Priority value

h3. Expected Results
* The priority value should be available even with a Space character.


h3. Actual Results
* No other Priority field value can be searched, shows below:
 !priority-field.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Values are showing as expected on Old Issue View
* This is happening to all single select list custom fields, eg:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!   

h3. Workaround
* Priority field - Go to the Priority Global Configuration [https://<your-instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewPriorities.jspa] and ensure that the Priority field doesn't have a <space> character after the end of the text string.
* Custom field - Configure the field and remove the leading or trailing whitespace from the option.
fields.summary: <space> character at the beginning/end of a Single Select List field value causes other values not to show on the new issue view

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian update - 19 November 2021}
Hi folks! Just updating you that we have picked this up and have started implementing a solution, which should solve most of the problems mentioned here. Expect an update on this post in a couple of weeks.

Cheers,
Andre | Product Manager, Linking Platform
----
Hi all! 
A quick update from the Jira issue and Smart Links teams.

Firstly, thanks for your ongoing, candid feedback. Please rest assured that we are closely monitoring your feedback and discussing internally. 

I understand this issue is increasingly causing challenges for our users. I'm currently working with our Smart Links team to explore this problem space to better understand nearer term improvements. 

I'll continue to update this ticket as I have more to share. 

Cheers, 
Venkatesh | Jira Issue PM
----
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use Jira so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days, however there are not currently any plans to implement this suggestion.

While we understand the logic for wanting to have different default options, our current focus is on making the unfurl states of Smart Links richer both inside and outside the editor across our products. Based off customer feedback, this is where we believe it’s most necessary to focus our efforts in the short-term.

In the meantime, you can change the Smart Link back to a normal url by clicking on the Smart Link in edit mode, and selecting “Display URL” from the toolbar dropdown.

We will continue to track this ticket and feedback across our various customer channels. Please remember that [jira.atlassian.com|http://jira.atlassian.com/] is one of many inputs for the Jira roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Venkatesh Vasudevan
vvasudevan@atlassian.com
Product Manager, Jira Cloud
{panel}
h3.  

*Problem Definition*

On the new issue view, whenever you paste a link on the Description or comment field, Jira initiates a Smart Link that will attempt to preview this link. It shows the below link "Connect to preview link"
!smart-link.png|thumbnail!
h3. *Suggestion*

Allow an option to be able to disable the Smart link by providing a "turn off/on" Smart link button, either on the Instance as a whole or on per Issue basis.
h3. *Workaround*

_Note: Current workarounds only apply when creating a smart link. As a user viewing a smart link there is no current workaround._

In order to remove the Smart link from rendering on the new issue view.
 - Paste the Google link for example, once it renders to preview the link
 - Press Ctrl + Z (Windows) or Cmd + Z (MacOS) (this will revert the link to a normal blue link)

Alternative workaround:
 - When inserting the link, be sure to use http:// instead of [https://|https:]. The Smart Card feature will not be activated, and upon visiting the URL, it will automatically redirect to https:// for these services.
fields.summary: Option to Disable Smart Links For Non-Atlassian Products in ADF editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Statuses created from Next-gen project are not visible in _https://<Cloud URL>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewStatuses.jspa_ but they do have sequence values in DB. When *non* next-gen statuses are moved up/down and its sequence are in between Next-gen statuses, the status just stay where it is. This could send the "wrong message" to the users where they thought the status isn't moved. In fact, it is moved; it's just that they are moved upper/lower than Next-gen status which isn't visible. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a non Next-gen status in between Next-gen statuses. Below is what it looks like from DB.
 ** sda
||id||sequence||pname||scope||
|11525|59|Done|P|
|11524|60|Jaap| |
|11526|61|To Do|P|
|11527|62|In Progress|P|
|11531|63|Lost| |

 # Move *Jaap* status down from https://<Cloud URL>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewStatuses.jspa

h3. Expected Results

_Jaap_ status is moved under _Lost_ status
h3. Actual Results

_Jaap_ status stays above _Lost_ status in the UI (the sequence is updated)
||id||sequence||pname||scope||
|11525|59|Done|P|
|11526|60|To Do|P|
|11524|61|Jaap| |
|11527|62|In Progress|P|
|11531|63|Lost| |
h3. Workaround

Keep moving the status down
fields.summary: Status is not moved when being moved up or down in View status page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When impersonating a user, on the notification panels from Jira/Confluence is respecting the permissions of the user that is impersonating (*Site-admin*) and not the permissions of the user that is being impersonated.

h3. Environment
Confluence/Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user *User B* without  permission on *Project A*
# Create a ticket to trigger a notification from Jira
# Have two users, *User A* as a  *site-admin* and *User B* as a regular user
# On notification panel of user B, nothing shows up
# When *User A* impersonate *User B* the notification of creating a Jira ticket shows up on the panel.

h3. Expected Results
The notification panel should respect the permissions of the user that is being impersonated *User B* and not display the notification from a restricted project.

h3. Actual Results
When impersonating the *User B* the quick search is not respecting the permissions of the impersonating user, instead, it is respecting the permissions of the *User A* (site-admin)
 

This leads the site-admin to believe that the impersonated user can get notified the activity from a restricted project but in fact, they can't.

h3.Workaround
No workaround so far
fields.summary: When impersonating a user the notification panel is not respecting the impersonated user permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the *new markdown editor*, when using the code snippet macro, if you type a '.' followed by an '\@' the editor calls the user picker macro and the code snippet is never closing. It also breaks that comment


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using the new markdown editor, try typing {code} `something.@.something`{code}
(The video below shows the behavior)
 [^code_snippet_bug.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
Depending on your programming scenario, is common to type, for examples, filenames as 'something.@.something', code snippet should work on those cases

h3. Actual Results

The comment breaks and throws an error message.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Before typing the '@' sign, type a '\' (escaping character), however, you'll need to erase the character afterward.
fields.summary: New Markdown editor breaks code snippet if you type '.' followed by an '@'

fields.description:
h4. Summary

In the past markup editor, it was possible to specify code languages using the keyboard, as one would type '\{code:language\}'. Nowadays, this is no longer possible, if you want to specify the *language* of your *code block* it is necessary to use the mouse. There is basically no shortcut for changing the code block language.

h4. Why is this important

* Jira provides a variety of shortcuts, this speeds up people's productivity, one can use shortcuts to start a code block but still will have to use the mouse to set the language.
* In the past this was possible to be configured without using the mouse.

h4. Suggested solution

Provide a keyboard shortcut to set-up the language of the code block.
fields.summary: New markdown editor lacks a shortcut for code block language selection

fields.description: At this moment, the project admin can't set the landing page of the project. It would be useful if this option is available in the project settings, in order to move the users to the important stuff in the project, according to what the project admin understands to be.
fields.summary: Ability to define landing page of projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

Currently a bulk operation in JIRA web app spams user with push notifications in mobile app -and notifications inside Jira-. For example if user is watcher in hundreds of issues and those issues are bulk updated, the user receives hundreds of push notifications in the mobile app, assuming watcher push notification is enabled in mobile app.
h3. Suggested resolution

Implement the ability to disable push notifications in JIRA mobile app-/notification center- for bulk operation in JIRA.

 

*NOTE:* In-App notifications are owned by a different team/component not relying on any push notification infrastructure, so it needs to be another ticket with the corresponding component associated.
fields.summary: Ability to disable push notifications for bulk operation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Many examples on the Jira Core REST API [v2|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/] and [v3|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3] are setting the header for Bearer authentication:  {{"Authentication: Bearer <api_token>"}}

This is confusing and often we can see in support tickets or in community threads that customers believe they have to use the [API Token|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/Vo71Nw] (that is supposed to be used for [Basic Authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-basic-authentication/] only) as the {{<api_token>}}.

It should be made clear that the header "Authentication: Bearer <api_token>" is intended to be used for [Oauth|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-oauth-authentication/] only.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3]
 # Search for an example related to any endpoint you may want to use, e.g. [GET issue|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueIdOrKey-get]

h3. Expected Results

The example should either not include authorization headers like the below one or show how to autenticate the requests in curl:
{noformat}
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://CLOUD_INSTANCE/rest/api/3/issue/{issueIdOrKey}' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'
{noformat}
OR:
{noformat}
curl -u <EMAIL_ADDRESS>:<API_TOKEN> \
  -H 'Accept: application/json' \
  -X GET 'https://CLOUD_INSTANCE/rest/api/3/issue/{issueIdOrKey}' 
{noformat}
h3. Actual Results

The example is setting the header for Bearer Authentication followed by the <access_token> that many customers are confusing with the [API Token|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/Vo71Nw]
{noformat}
curl --request GET \
  --url '/rest/api/2/issue/createmeta' \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <access_token>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Use the below format to authenticate REST API calls with Curl depending on the kind of authentication:
 - *Basic Authentication*
{noformat}
curl -u <EMAIL_ADDRESS>:<API_TOKEN> ... [followed by the headers, method, body (if any) and url] 
{noformat}
OR
{noformat}
curl --header "Authorization: Basic XXXXXXXX" ... [followed by the other headers, method, body (if any) and url] 
{noformat}
Where XXXXXXXX is the string <EMAIL_ADDRESS>:<API_TOKEN> encoded in base64. For more details please review: [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-basic-authentication/]

 - *Oauth:*
{noformat}
curl --header "Authorization: Bearer XXXXXXXX" ... [followed by the other headers, method, body (if any) and url] 
{noformat}
Where XXXXXXXX is the access token obtained as explained in: [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-oauth-authentication/]
fields.summary: The examples in the REST API v2 and v3 documentation pages can cause confusion

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
When timestamp values (e.g Worklog) are retrieved through REST API the values will be based on the timezone of JIRA instance. REST API response does not contains the timezone offset or any clarification about the timestamp value retrieved. This could cause a lot of pains to understand which timezone the data is based on.

h3. Suggested resolution
Please update REST API documentation and add the clarification about timezone for endpoints that returns a timestamp value. For example, add the information about the timezone data (timestamp) is based on, and how to get the timezone.
fields.summary: Update REST API documentation about timestamp values

fields.description:
|*Atlassian - 13th May 2021*|
|Hi everyone,
 
If you're still experiencing this when viewing an issue then you're actually experiencing https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-69810
Please add your votes and comments to that issue so we can accurately determine the impact/priority and hopefully the issue view team will have it fixed soon.
 
Regards,
Atlassian|

 

 

Summary
 When a user tries to edit the global time tracking settings, the time display format drop-down shows pretty format as the currently selected one even if actually set to hours or days. The drop-down does not pick up the value selected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to _Jira Settings> Issues > Time Tracking_
 # Use _Edit Global Settings_ to edit the time tracking format.
 # Set Time tracking format to Hours and save the changes.
 # Refresh the page.
 # Try to Edit Global settings again.

h3. Expected Results

The Time display format drop-down shows "Hours" as the selected one.
h3. Actual Results

The time display format drop-down resets and shows the first option(pretty format) as the current setting.
fields.summary: Time display format dropdown when editing time tracking setting always show pretty format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Calling [Search for issues using JQL|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-search-get] REST API and passing a {{jql}} to get issues with specific Epic Links returns issues with _null_ Epic Link values and {{versionedRepresentations}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Story
# Add an Epic Link (let's say with EPIC-1 with an ID of 40302)
# Do a [search|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-search-get] with the following query parameters {{jql=<epic_link_cf_id> in (40302)&expand= versionedRepresentations}} -> this is still OK (/)
# Move EPIC-1 to a project where Epic Link custom field is not part of the screen
# Do the same search

h3. Actual Results
The previous issue is still part of the result set but with Epic Link custom fields values in {{versionedRepresentations}} set to _null_
{code}
    "issues": [
        {
            "expand": "operations,versionedRepresentations,editmeta,changelog,renderedFields",
            "id": "10117",
            "self": "https://iangil.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/10117",
            "key": "TEST-60",
            "versionedRepresentations": {
                "customfield_10008": { //Epic Link
                    "1": null,
                    "2": null
                }
            }
        }
    ]
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Since Epic Link field of value "40302" was searched, it should only return issues with that value. However, in this specific scenario, even though it is already null, it is still returned.


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: versionedRepresentations for Epic Link field returns null when doing a REST API search

fields.description:

h3. Expected Results

The issue then becomes not editable

h3. Actual Results

The issue is still editable

h3. Note
Same result on Jira mobile application

h3. Workaround  

Currently, there is no workaround available
fields.summary: jira.issue.editable property does not work for new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When searching for a user using a JQL function such as _changed TO_ that relies on data in the *changeitem* table the *user_key* value must be used otherwise no results are returned.

This is problematic if the user key is a non frontend viewable string such as a UUID.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user and give them a UUID as the user_key.
 # Make some assignee changes to ensure this populated into the changeitem table. 
 # Try to search for a user using {noformat}assignee changed TO <email/displayname>{noformat} 

h3. Expected Results
The user should be searchable by the email address or display name. 

h3. Actual Results
No results are returned unless the *user_key* value is used. 

h3. Notes
This affects other historic JQL operators such as *WAS*.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Searching for a user in JQL using 'changed TO' requires user_key to return results.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The JQL functions such as "assignee changed TO" that use the *changeitem* table for lookup are still searching on user_key.

This causes issues if the user_key is a UUID or some unknown non-visible string such as the ID value of the database row. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use the search function _"assignee changed TO <XXX>"_  and try to search on email or display name.


h3. Expected Results
Users should be search able by display name or email.

h3. Actual Results
Results are only returned if users *user_key* value is given.

h3. Notes
This relates to the GDPR deprecations of usernames. 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JQL functions relying on changeitem table need to updated to search on display name or email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using *startAt* parameter to set page offset for [Fine Users|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-user-search-get] REST API only works for first 1000 users. It does not return users with index more than 1000.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add more than 1000 active users (e.g 1100 users)
# Run following curl command to use [Find Users|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-user-search-get] REST API to get list of users:
{code}
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://<siteName>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user/search?startAt=1000&maxResults=100&query' \
  --header 'Authorization: Basic <email:apitoken(base64encoded)>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Assuming there are >=1100 users in the site, this call should return list of users from index 1000 to index 1100

h3. Actual Results
It returns no result

h3. Notes
This works for users with index less than 1000, for example following curl command works fine:
{code}
curl --request GET \
  --url 'https://<siteName>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/user/search?startAt=100&maxResults=100&query' \
  --header 'Authorization: Basic <email:apitoken(base64encoded)>' \
  --header 'Accept: application/json'
{code}

h3. Workaround
Export users through JIRA User Management
fields.summary: startAt page offset does not work for more than 1000 users in find user REST API (/rest/api/3/user/search)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The links to the issues from Qtest Plugin are not displayed in New issue view
The links are visible in the old issue view
h3. Environment
Qtest Plugin.
any Jira cloud site.
Jira software projects

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Creates issues via Qtest Plugin.
* Link it to Jira software issues.
* These links are not available in the New issue view.

h3. Expected Results
Links should be visible

h3. Actual Results
Links to qtest issues are not visible


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The links to the issue from  Qtest Plugin are not displayed in New issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Email notifications are being delivered however, the sender is displayed as *"Failed to retrieve user"* in the _"From"_ field.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generate an email notification event.

h3. Expected Results
The sender is displayed as the user who created the change and triggered the notification event. 

h3. Actual Results
The sender is displayed as  *"Failed to retrieve user"*

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
Sending email with Message-Id <JIRA.761671.1562017467000.<aaid>@Atlassian.JIRA>: To='"?"' Subject='xxxxxxx' From='null' 
FromName='"Failed to Retrieve User <aaid>" (JIRA)' EnvelopeFrom='null' Cc='null' Bcc='null' ReplyTo='null' InReplyTo='<JIRA.761671.1562017467000@Atlassian.JIRA>' MimeType='text/html' Encoding='UTF-8' Multipart='javax.mail.internet.MimeMultipart@28341720' MessageId='<JIRA.761671.1562017467000.<aaid>@Atlassian.JIRA>' ExcludeSubjectPrefix=false'
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This is a graphical issues and the functionality is not impacted.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Email notifications are showing "Failed to retrieve user" as the sender

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When *jira.issue.editable* is set to *false* on the workflow status, we will not able to delete the comment. However, the "Delete" option is shown on the new issue view and a misleading error message is shown when we attempt to delete the comment.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud new issue view
* Workflow status: {{jira.issue.editable=false}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit the workflow and add a workflow property to "Done" status
#* Property Key: jira.issue.editable	
#* Property Value: false
# Publish the workflow
# Attempt to delete a comment with "Done" status

h3. Expected Results
* "Delete" option is not showing. Example on old issue view:
** "jira.issue.editable" is true:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
** "jira.issue.editable" is false:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* "Delete" option is available on new issue view:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
* A misleading error message is shown:
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

The below exception is thrown in the HAR file:
{noformat}
https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/PROJECT-11/comment/10000 400 Bad Request

{"errorMessages":["You can not delete the comment as the issue is in a non-editable workflow state."
],"errors":{}}
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Temporarily remove "jira.issue.editable" property from the Status to enable comment deletion feature
fields.summary: Incorrect error message shown when deleting a comment on new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a search is performed using pasted text from Microsoft Excel, Jira adds the text copied from Excel as an image attachment. 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud & Microsoft Excel

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View any issue in [the new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html]
# Copy a string from Microsoft Excel
# Trigger issue search via the side panel or the keyboard shortcut '/' 
# Paste the string into the _Search Jira_ field
# Cancel the search by clicking anywhere or the keyboard shortcut 'ESC'
# Observe the attachment

h3. Expected Results
No attachment added 

h3. Actual Results
Search text is added to Jira issue as an image file (.png)

h3. Notes
* This only affects text or string copied from Microsoft Excel. Text or string from Microsoft Word or Google Sheet is not affected
* This also seems to happen when there is more media than text in what is copied, having an image in the clipboard also causes the same behavior.
* The same behaviour is noticed while creating a Sub-Task from the Parent issue as well. The copied text from Excel file is added to the parent ticket.


h3. Workaround
-Disable the new issue view. To do it, please follow the steps described below:-

# -Go to Jira home page and click on the avatar at the bottom-left of the screen and then click on *Personal settings*-
# -Under *Jira labs*, next to *New Jira issue view for software projects*, disable this feature by clicking on the green button (it will become gray and a feedback pop-up will appear)-

There is no workaround at this time as We're currently transitioning everyone to the new issue view, so you're no longer able to switch back to the old issue view. [Learn more | https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/what-is-the-new-jira-issue-view/]
fields.summary: Jira adds an attachment during search using pasted text from Microsoft Excel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Intermittently getting HTTP status 405 for [Edit issue|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueIdOrKey-put] REST API with an error saying "PSQL_TOO_MANY_CONNECTIONS".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit an issue by calling [Edit issue|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueIdOrKey-put] REST API

h3. Expected Results
Successful response with status 204

h3. Actual Results
HTTP status 405.
 !HTTP_405.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Intermittently happens
* Looks related with JRACLOUD-71836 and JRACLOUD-70291 but with a different HTTP status code

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior aside from doing a retry.
fields.summary: Intermittently getting PSQL_TOO_MANY_CONNECTIONS from PUT rest/api/2/issue/{id} endpoint with HTTP status 405
